data.title: Bountiful goodness in the Brockton Arcade
data.text:
I met my brothers for our Friday late lunch at Angel Thai Cuisine. what a pleasant surprise.  One of us had been before and highly recommended the Spicy Seafood (15.95) but most of us decided on the lunch special (7.99). When I read the description of a seafood medley stir fried with peppers, onions, basil and bamboo shoots, I was sold! Even though priced at almost twice the "special" it was worth every penny. Mussels fresh and plump, cooked just right. The shrimp, calimari and fish fillet were perfect in the spicy (not too spicy, thank you) flavorful sauce!
The pork spare ribs were flavorful and not over sauced, tender but not mushy. The orange chicken, pork pad thai and chicken pepper and garlic, all got the nod and the vegetable soup and egg roll added to the value of the lunch special.
The food and service left us satisfied and feeling that the tim had passed way too quickly!

data.title: Fresh Thai Flavors
data.text:
Angel Thai may not have the most curb appeal but walk inside and you will be treated to one of the Inland Empires better Thai finds.

The decor inside is comfortable and mirrored walls create the illusion of space.

You immediately smell the garlic, basil and soy from the kitchen.

The staff is friendly and food arrives promptly but this is family speed not chain restaurant speed. Generally there is only one or two servers and they share hostess, phone order and cashier duties. 

Angel Thai does a very robust take out business. The phone is always ringing and patrons pull up to the curb on Brockton to run inside to pick up their to go orders.

The food is quite good. Nice selection of the standards with a few extras like duck or whole fried tilapia. Plenty of curries and very vegetarian friendly. Something for everyone.

The spicy fried basil rice is very fragrant with just the right amount of heat. I recommend choosing shrimp as the
e protein here.

Glass noodle aka Pad Woon Sen are also quite nice with an array of vegetables added in. Chicken makes a nice addition.

The appetizer plate for four makes a nice opener with plenty of fried goodies such as shrimp and Thai rolls for everyone to try.

The Thai Iced Tea is pulled off nicely witha creamy almost velvet like texture.

Parking is easier in the back lot and there is a rear entrance.

Visa and Mastercard are welcome and they are open on Sundays.

data.title: Good value, good food
data.text: We love to pop in and out of Angel Thai when time is important. Their food is great and priced right. Our favorite dish is the Salmon salad, it is delicious.

data.title: CAN YOU MAKE IT TO THE JOHN IN 2.5 SECONDS?
data.text: Ordered the seafood Pad Thai....hold, on, I ordered a main meal not dessert.  The darn thing was so sweet that the only thing I could taste was the sugar. Totally ruined it....i know Thai restaurants add sweeteners to their food, but this was ridiculous....there was a glaze all over the noodles.....could not eat them. Now here comes the best part...the dish came with shrimp, clams, crab meat and fish..soon as I ate it, my stomach started rumbling....had to run to the John..... had a bad case of diaherria.....which means  the meat had gone bad. Came home, more of the same problem.  Wife ordered the Veg. green curry, the veggies were raw even though she told the waitress to cook them.  Would not go back again.

data.title: OK, but nothing worth remembering.
data.text: A little shop in Brockton Arcade.  Sort of drab but clean.  Could use an upgrade.  Service was friendly, but a little slow to bring us our bill.  Thai iced tea was good.  The soup of the day (which came with our lunch special) was lukewarm and lacked flavor.  We ordered handrolls as an appetizer and the ingredients were fresh. The Orange Chicken was good, but the coating was a bit doughy.  The Vegetable/Chicken was rather bland and the chicken a bit rubbery.  Again, served lukewarm.  We will keep looking for the best Thai place in Riverside.
